| subdivision_ranks = Genera subdivision =
}} The 'Saccharomycetaceae' are a family of yeast in the order Saccharomycetales
that reproduce by budding. Species in the family have a cosmopolitan
distribution, and are present in a wide variety of habitats, especially those
with a plentiful supply of carbohydrate sources. The family contains
the species [[Saccharomyces cerevisiae]], arguably the most economically
important fungus.
